fullDescription.intro: This node can visualize a graph with different layouts. The node table in port 1 must contain node IDs and the edge table in port 2 must contain source and target node IDs. Any data in the node or edge table can be used for highlighting (as explained below).

tab.name: Input
tab.option: Node table column containing the node IDs.
Edge table column containing the node IDs of the source nodes.
Edge table column containing the node IDs of the target nodes.
When checked a svg graphic instead of a png is put in the ouput port.

tab.name: Left Options Bar
tab.option: Layout to visualize the graph.
Diameter of the nodes.
Current editing mode. If "Transforming" is selected the user can move the graph by using the mouse. In "Picking" mode the user can select and unselect nodes and edges.

tab.name: Right Options Bar
tab.option: Alpha value used to draw the geographical borders.
Diameter of the location circles.
Alpha value used to draw the edges.

Current editing mode. If "Transforming" is selected the user can move the map by using the mouse. In "Node Picking" mode the user can select and unselect nodes. "Edge Picking" mode is for selecting and unselecting edges.

tab.name: Left Context Menu
tab.option: All highlighted nodes are selected.
Clears the selected nodes.
Shows the properties of all selected nodes.
All highlighted edges are selected.
Selects all edges, whose origin and destinations nodes are already selected.
Clears the selected edges.
Shows the properties of all selected edges.
Opens a dialog that allows specifying multiple highlight conditions for the nodes. How to create a highlight condition is explained in the "Highlight Condition Dialog"-section.
Removes all node highlight conditions.
Opens a dialog that allows specifying multiple highlight conditions for the edges. How to create a highlight condition is explained in the "Highlight Condition Dialog"-section.
Removes all edge highlight conditions.
The image as can be saved as a PNG- or SVG-file.

tab.name: Right Context Menu
tab.option: All highlighted regions are selected.
Clears the selected regions.
Shows the properties of all selected regions.
All highlighted edges are selected.
Selects all edges, whose origin and destinations regions are already selected.
Clears the selected edges.
Shows the properties of all selected edges.
Opens a dialog that allows specifying multiple highlight conditions for the regions. How to create a highlight condition is explained in the "Highlight Condition Dialog"-section.
Removes all region highlight conditions.
Opens a dialog that allows specifying multiple highlight conditions for the edges. How to create a highlight condition is explained in the "Highlight Condition Dialog"-section.
Removes all edge highlight conditions.
Resets the layout so that map perfectly fits in the window.
The image as can be saved as a PNG- or SVG-file.

tab.name: Highlight Condition Dialog
tab.option: Type of the condition. One option is a logical condition, which is an And/Or conjunction of logical expressions like "City == Berlin" or "Inhabitants > 10". It can only be true or false. In the "Logical Condition"-section it is shown how to create a logical condition. The other option is a value condition, for example "Log value of Inhabitants". In the "Value Condition"-section it is shown how to create a value condition.

Color of the highlighted elements. For a logical conditions all true elements are painted. For a value condition all elements with values > 0 are painted (the higher the value the higher alpha value used for painting).
Property, that should be used as a label for all painted elements.

tab.name: Logical Condition
tab.option: When a logical conditions consists of multiple expressions, And/Or conjunctions between these expressions must be specified. "And"-conjunctions will be evaluated before "Or"-conjunctions.
Property of the logical expression. Is compared to "Value".
Type of the logical expression.
Value of the logical expression. Is compared to "Property".

tab.name: Value Condition
tab.option: Property of the value condition.
Type of the value condition. If "Log Value" is used, the logarithmic function with base 10 is applied to all property values, before visualizing. For "Value" no function is applied.
